cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then turning northwest and north toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southern Florida peninsula, eastern Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast of Alabama–Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈5%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds likely remain below 34 kt at PortMiami.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side; surge confined mainly to the Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches possible, producing urban and small-stream flooding around Miami-Dade County.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Saturday–Sunday; rough seas and long-period swells may affect vessel traffic near the port.
